Yes, I believe that Verizon will continue to prioritize digital solutions and virtual capabilities even after the pandemic subsides. The pandemic has accelerated the adoption of digital technologies, and many of the changes to customer behavior and preferences are expected to persist even after the pandemic ends.

Verizon has recognized this shift and has already made significant investments in digital solutions and virtual capabilities even before the pandemic. These investments have allowed the company to respond quickly to the changing needs of its customers and remote workforces when the pandemic hit.

Going forward, Verizon is likely to continue investing in digital solutions due to the many benefits they offer to customers, such as convenience, efficiency, and cost savings. Also, digital solutions can enhance customer experiences and help the company maintain a competitive advantage in a crowded market.

Verizon is also likely to continue its focus on virtual capabilities, including virtual healthcare services, virtual meetings, and remote work capabilities. These capabilities have proven to be highly valuable during the pandemic, and it is expected that they will continue to be in demand in a post-pandemic world.

Overall, I believe that Verizon will prioritize digital solutions and virtual capabilities as a significant part of its long-term strategy, driven by the continued demand for these solutions from its customers.
